title: Prefabricated Effluent Treatment Plant
subtitle: Turn industrial effluent into reusable, clean water.

infoContent.paragraph: Our Prefabricated Effluent Treatment Plants (ETPs) are engineered to efficiently treat industrial effluents and transform them into reusable, clean water—supporting sustainability and resource conservation. Designed with a compact, modular, and plug-and-play architecture, these systems integrate seamlessly into existing operations with minimal disruption in Manufacturing & Process Industries (automotive, chemical, textile, plastics, pharmaceuticals), Hospitals & Healthcare Institutions & Food & Beverage Processing Units.
points: Plug & Play Design: Factory-built, ready-to-install units.
Quick Installation: Minimal civil work and reduced setup time.
Compact & Portable: Easy to transport and relocate.
Low Maintenance: Designed for hassle-free operation.
High Efficiency: Ensures consistent water quality.
Eco-Friendly: Supports water reuse and sustainable practices.
Versatile Applications: Suitable for residential, commercial, and industrial needs.

title: Packaged Water Treatment Plant
subtitle: Compact, all-in-one solutions for potable water.

infoContent.paragraph: A Prefabricated Water Treatment Plant is a plug-and-play solution designed for quick deployment and efficient treatment of water and wastewater. Built in modular units, these plants require minimal civil work, reduce installation time, and ensure reliable performance — making them ideal for industries, institutions, residential complexes, and remote locations.
points: Plug & Play Design: Factory-built, ready-to-install units.
Quick Installation: Minimal civil work and reduced setup time.
Compact & Portable: Easy to transport and relocate.
Low Maintenance: Designed for hassle-free operation.

title: Ultrafiltration Systems (UF)
subtitle: High-performance membrane filtration for suspended solids.

infoContent.paragraph: Ultrafiltration Plants use advanced membrane technology to remove suspended solids, bacteria, viruses, and high molecular weight contaminants from water. Operating under low pressure, UF systems offer superior filtration compared to conventional methods while retaining essential minerals. They are ideal for tertiary treatment, pre-treatment to RO systems, and in industrial, commercial, and municipal applications. Known for their high recovery rate, easy operation, and consistent output quality, UF plants are a reliable solution for producing clean and safe water.
points: Advanced Membrane Filtration.
Low Operating Cost & Easy Maintenance.
Integration with Other Systems.
Available from 1 m³/hr to 1,000 m³/hr and beyond.
High-Quality Treated WaterSkid mounted, prefabricated units for easy installation and relocation.

ctaText: Find out if UF is the right solution for your needs.

title: Reverse Osmosis Systems (RO)
subtitle: The ultimate solution for demineralized, pure water.

infoContent.paragraph: Reverse Osmosis (RO) plants use a semi-permeable membrane and high pressure to remove dissolved salts, minerals, heavy metals, and other impurities from water, making it safe for various applications after being used in conjunction with pre-treatment units like sand and carbon filters.
points: Advanced Purification Technology.
Removes TDS, hardness, heavy metals, bacteria, and viruses.
Equipped with PLC/SCADA integration for real‑time monitoring.
Built with FRP, SS, or MS powder‑coated frames for durability and corrosion resistance.

ctaText: Talk to an expert about our RO system capabilities.
ctasubText: Learn more about our bio-digester technology.

title: Pressure Sand Filters (PSF)
subtitle: Reliable and effective removal of suspended solids.

infoContent.paragraph: A Pressure Sand Filter is a widely used filtration system designed to remove suspended solids, turbidity, and particulate matter from water. It operates under pressure, forcing water through multiple layers of quartz sand and gravel media to trap impurities. PSFs are commonly used in water treatment plants, industrial processes, and commercial applications as a pre-treatment step before disinfection or further purification. Known for their simplicity, efficiency, and low maintenance, these filters help ensure consistent water quality and protect downstream equipment.

ctaText: Request a quote for a pressure sand filter.
ctasubText: Learn more about our bio-digester technology.

title: Activated Carbon Filters (ACF)
subtitle: Remove chlorine, odor, and organic compounds.

infoContent.paragraph: Activated Carbon Filters are essential in water and wastewater treatment for removing organic compounds, chlorine, odor, color, and residual chemicals. These filters use high-grade activated carbon media with a large surface area that adsorbs impurities as water passes through. Commonly used after Pressure Sand Filters, ACFs improve taste, reduce harmful contaminants, and prepare water for safe discharge or reuse. They are ideal for residential, commercial, and industrial applications requiring high water quality standards.

ctaText: Explore the benefits of activated carbon filtration.
ctasubText: Learn more about our bio-digester technology.

title: Lamella Clarifier
subtitle: High-rate clarifiers for efficient solids separation.

infoContent.paragraph: A Lamella Clarifier, also known as a Inclined Plate Settler, is a compact sedimentation device used to efficiently remove suspended solids from wastewater. It uses a series of inclined plates to increase the settling surface area, allowing particles to settle faster and in a smaller footprint compared to traditional clarifiers. Lamella Clarifiers are ideal for space constrained sites and are commonly used in STPs, ETPs, and pre-treatment systems for high-efficiency solids removal with low maintenance.
points: Compact & High-Efficiency Design.
Superior Solid-Liquid Separation.
Low Operation & Maintenance.
Wide Range of Applications.
Customizable & Modular.
Economic & Sustainable.
Space-Saving Solution.

ctaText: Get a quote for a compact lamella clarifier.

title: Clarifier Mechanism
subtitle: Advanced systems for sediment removal and clarification.

infoContent.paragraph: A Clarifier Mechanism is a key component in wastewater treatment systems, designed to separate solid particles (sludge) from treated water through sedimentation. Installed within primary or secondary clarifiers, this mechanism typically includes a rotating scraper arm that gently moves settled sludge toward a central hopper for removal. Clarifiers help produce clear, low-turbidity water and improve the efficiency of downstream treatment processes. They are essential for maintaining consistent water quality in both Sewage and Effluent Treatment Plants
points: Removes suspended solids, sludge, and turbidity from wastewater.
Available in MS, MSRL, or SS materials for long service life.
Handles high hydraulic and organic loads efficiently.
Low-maintenance gear and bearing assemblies.
Reduces chemical dosing requirements when paired with tube settlers.

ctaText: Consult with an expert on our clarifier mechanisms.

title: Tube Settlers
subtitle: Increase the settling capacity of clarification tanks.

infoContent.paragraph: Tube Settlers are compact, high-efficiency sedimentation systems that use inclined tubular modules to increase the effective settling area for suspended solids. By allowing particles to settle quickly in a smaller footprint, they enhance clarification efficiency by up to 6–8 times compared to conventional basins. Prefabricated and easy to install, tube settlers are widely used in water treatment plants, sewage treatment plants, and industrial effluent systems to improve solid liquid separation, reduce turbidity, and optimize downstream treatment processes.
points: High-Efficiency Sedimentation: Uses inclined tubular modules to enhance settling area, increasing clarification efficiency by up to 6–8 times compared to conventional basins.
Compact & Modular Design: Prefabricated units reduce civil construction requirements and save up to 70% space, making them ideal for industries with limited land.
Durable Construction: Manufactured in FRP/MS with epoxy coating for strength and corrosion resistance, the lightweight modules allow for easy transport and installation.
Low Operation & Maintenance: With minimal mechanical parts, these systems are easy to clean and maintain, providing a long service life with reduced downtime.
Industry Applications: Municipal Water & Sewage Treatment Plants, Food & Beverage Industry, Textile & Dyeing, Sugar & Distilleries, Pharmaceutical & Chemical Industries, Mining & Metal Processing
Customization & Scalability: Available in various module sizes and inclinations (commonly 60°), these systems can be scaled from small industrial plants to large municipal facilities.

title: Water Softeners
subtitle: Eliminate hard water issues for improved performance.

infoContent.paragraph: Water Softeners are specialized treatment units designed to remove hardness-causing minerals like calcium and magnesium from water through an ion exchange process. These units help prevent scaling in pipelines, boilers, and appliances, improving their efficiency and lifespan. Commonly used in residential, commercial, and industrial setups, water softeners ensure smooth operation of equipment and enhance the effectiveness of soaps and detergents. They are an essential part of any water management system in areas with hard water supply.
points: Effective Hardness Removal.
Consistent Water Quality.
Skid‑mounted units for quick installation and minimal civil work.
Wide Industrial & Commercial Applications.
Meets industry norms for process and utility water requirements.

ctaText: Find the perfect water softener for your home or business.

title: Demineralization Systems (DM)
subtitle: Produce high-purity water for critical applications.

infoContent.paragraph: Demineralization Plants are specialized water treatment systems that remove dissolved salts and minerals through ion exchange technology, producing high purity water. Typically used in industries like pharmaceuticals, power plants, electronics, and laboratories, DM plants eliminate ions such as calcium, magnesium, sodium, chlorides, and sulfates. The process involves cation and anion exchange resins, and often includes a mixed bed for polishing. DM water is essential for applications where mineral-free, non-conductive water is required.
points: High-Purity Water Production
Proven Ion Exchange Technology
Robust & Compact Design
Ease of Operation & Maintenance
Wide Industrial Applications
Economic & Sustainable
Compliance & Quality Assurance

title: Chemical Dosing Systems
subtitle: Precise and automated chemical delivery for water treatment.

infoContent.paragraph: Chemical Dosing Systems are precision-engineered units used to automatically dose specific quantities of chemicals into water or wastewater for effective treatment. Commonly used for pH correction, disinfection, coagulation, and scaling control, these systems ensure consistent dosing, reduce manual errors, and enhance treatment efficiency. Ideal for STPs, ETPs, RO plants, and cooling towers, they typically include a dosing pump, chemical storage tank, and control panel, and can be customized for both manual and automated operations.
points: Precise & Reliable Dosing
Robust & Modular Design
Material & Build Options
Automation & Control
Wide Industry Applications
Operational Efficiency
Safety & Compliance
Customization & Scalability

title: Bio-Digesters
subtitle: Sustainable and efficient waste decomposition technology.

infoContent.paragraph: Bio-Digesters use anaerobic bacteria to break down organic waste, producing clean energy (biogas) and organic fertilizer. These systems are an environmentally friendly way to manage waste from households, communities, and food processing industries.
points: Advanced FRP Bio-Digester Systems: Manufactured using Fiberglass Reinforced Plastic (FRP) for durability, lightweight handling, and corrosion resistance, with a leak-proof and maintenance-free design for a long service life.

Eco-Friendly Sanitation Solutions: Treats human and organic waste through anaerobic bacterial digestion to produce pathogen-free water suitable for gardening, flushing, or safe discharge. This process also reduces foul odors, sludge, and the need for frequent desludging.

Compact & Modular Designs: Capacities range from 500 Liters to 10,000 Liters and are available in rectangular and customized shapes. They are easy to transport, install, and integrate into both remote and urban locations.

Applications Across Sectors: Ideal for areas without sewer infrastructure or with limited water supply, and suitable for residential colonies, schools, hospitals, defense camps, railway coaches, rural sanitation projects, and community toilets.
Sustainability & Compliance: Aligns with global SDG sanitation goals and promotes zero discharge, water conservation, and environmental protection.

ctaText: Learn more about our bio-digester technology.

title: Bio-Toilets
subtitle: Eco-friendly, self-contained sanitation solutions.

infoContent.paragraph: Our Bio-Toilets use bio-digester technology to treat human waste at the source, eliminating the need for a traditional sewage system. They are perfect for remote locations, public spaces, and mobile applications, providing a hygienic and sustainable sanitation solution.
points: Bio-Toilets Integration: Prefabricated and mobile units equipped with bio-digester tanks.
Hygienic Sanitation: Ensures hygienic sanitation facilities in construction sites, public events, and disaster relief zones.

title: InFlow Hydration Monitoring System
subtitle: Advanced technology to monitor hydration levels in real-time.

infoContent.paragraph: The InFlow Hydration Monitoring System provides continuous, non-invasive hydration data to help athletes and health-conscious individuals optimize their fluid intake. This technology helps prevent dehydration, improve performance, and support overall wellness.
points: Next-Generation Hydration Monitoring: The world’s first real-time, non-invasive urine analysis device for hydration tracking, providing instant and accurate hydration status through color codes.
Key Features: This first-of-its-kind, patent-backed device is compact, hygienic, and touch-free, and it measures hydration levels within seconds.

Health & Performance Benefits: This device supports preventive healthcare by detecting early signs of imbalance, which helps prevent the risks of dehydration and over-hydration and improves workplace safety, athletic performance, and patient care.

Technology & Innovation: Based on proprietary light spectrum analysis, the device uses reflectance spectroscopy and proprietary algorithms, making it energy-efficient with low maintenance requirements.

Applications Across Sectors: Used in hospitals and clinics for patient hydration monitoring to ensure faster recovery, in sports and fitness to optimize athlete performance and recovery, in workplaces and industries to enhance worker safety and productivity, and in defense and aviation for critical hydration monitoring in high-stress environments.
